SetupDetails.QuestTitle: Example: Extract the Prisoners, Eliminate the Soldier
SetupDetails.QuestDesc: Extract the two prisoners at the Serak Power Plant, and eliminate the enemy soldier.

Operation.Name: Get Total Target Count
Operation.Description: Updates a variable to the number of total target objectives in the sideop.

Choice.Name: Number Variable
Choice.Description: The variable to copy the table count to.

Value.Template: local totalTargets = 0 if mvars.ene_questTargetList then for _, targetInfo in pairs(mvars.ene_questTargetList) do if targetInfo.isTarget == true then totalTargets = totalTargets + 1 end end end if mvars.ani_questTargetList then for _, _ in pairs(mvars.ani_questTargetList) do totalTargets = totalTargets + 1 end end if qvars.ObjectiveTypeList and qvars.ObjectiveTypeList.targetItemList then for _, _ in pairs(qvars.ObjectiveTypeList.targetItemList) do totalTargets = totalTargets + 1 end end return totalTargets

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Choice.Name: Comparison
Choice.Description: The comparison function.

Choice.Name: Num1
Choice.Description: The number on the left-hand side of the comparison.

Choice.Name: Num2
Choice.Description: The number on the right-hand side of the comparison.

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Choice.Name: Comparison
Choice.Description: The comparison function.

Choice.Name: Num1
Choice.Description: The number on the left-hand side of the comparison.

Choice.Name: Num2
Choice.Description: The number on the right-hand side of the comparison.

Operation.Name: Win
Operation.Description: The player immediately wins the sideop. Operations and scripts in the triggered event will finish executing, but any new events will not trigger sideop scripts.

Operation.Name: Print Sideop Progress Notification
Operation.Description: Prints the Progress Notification associated to the current sideop, given a current tally of the objectives completed and the total count of objectives.
Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempCurrentObjectiveCount = |[1|NUMBER]| local tempTotalObjectiveCount = |[2|NUMBER]| local showAnnounceLogId = TppQuest.questCompleteLangIds[ TppQuest.GetCurrentQuestName() ] if showAnnounceLogId then TppUI.ShowAnnounceLog(showAnnounceLogId, tempCurrentObjectiveCount, tempTotalObjectiveCount) end

Choice.Name: Objectives Completed
Choice.Description: The number of objectives that the player has completed thus far.

Choice.Name: Total Objectives
Choice.Description: The total number of objectives in the sideop.

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Operation.Name: Lose
Operation.Description: The player immediately loses the sideop. Operations and scripts in the triggered event will finish executing, but any new events will not trigger sideop scripts.

Operation.Name: Print Sideop Progress Notification

Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempCurrentObjectiveCount = |[1|NUMBER]| local tempTotalObjectiveCount = |[2|NUMBER]| local showAnnounceLogId = TppQuest.questCompleteLangIds[ TppQuest.GetCurrentQuestName() ] if showAnnounceLogId then TppUI.ShowAnnounceLog(showAnnounceLogId, tempCurrentObjectiveCount, tempTotalObjectiveCount) end

Operation.Name: Lose

Operation.Name: Set Variable To Random Number
Operation.Description: Updates a custom number-variable to a random number within a defined range.

Choice.Name: Variable
Choice.Description: The custom variable that the random value will be set to.

Choice.Name: From
Choice.Description: The lowest value that the random number can return.

Choice.Name: To
Choice.Description: The highest value that the random number can return.

Operation.Name: Get Table Value
Operation.Description: Retrieves a value in a table at the specified key/index

Choice.Name: Table
Choice.Description: The table to be that stores the value.

Choice.Name: Key
Choice.Description: The key (or index) of the value to be retrieved.

Choice.Name: Storage Variable
Choice.Description:
The variable to copy the value to.
Warning: due to the ambiguous value type of the response, any variable type is accepted for this choice. However, this may cause type inconsistencies if the command returns a mismatching value type. It is recommended to know exactly what type of value will be returned from the command, so that the variable type can match.

Operation.Name: Warp
Operation.Description:
Immediately and unceremoniously teleports the target to a new position. Compatible with the player character, prisoners and vehicles.
- For most events, 'arg1' represents the GameObjectId that sent the event. For GeoTraps, 'arg2' is the GameObjectId that entered/exited. - The embedded Warp function was yoinked from Infinite Heaven
Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempGameObjectIdVal = |[1|STRING,NUMBER]| if type(tempGameObjectIdVal) == "string" then tempGameObjectIdVal = GetGameObjectId(tempGameObjectIdVal) end qvars.Warp(tempGameObjectIdVal, |[2|TABLE]|)

Choice.Name: Game Object
Choice.Description: The character or vehicle to be warped.

Choice.Name: X, Y, Z, rotY Table
Choice.Description: A table that contains 3 numbers for X, Y, Z coordinates, and an optional 4th number for degree rotation.

Value.Template: rotY=rotY or pos[4] or 0 local typeIndex=GameObject.GetTypeIndex(gameId) if typeIndex==TppGameObject.GAME_OBJECT_TYPE_PLAYER2 then rotY=foxmath.NormalizeRadian(foxmath.DegreeToRadian(rotY)) local command={id="WarpAndWaitBlock",pos=pos,rotY=rotY} GameObject.SendCommand(gameId,command) elseif typeIndex==TppGameObject.GAME_OBJECT_TYPE_VEHICLE then pos=Vector3(pos[1],pos[2],pos[3]) rotY=foxmath.NormalizeRadian(foxmath.DegreeToRadian(rotY)) GameObject.SendCommand(gameId,{id="SetPosition",position=pos,rotY=rotY}) elseif typeIndex==TppGameObject.GAME_OBJECT_TYPE_WALKERGEAR2 or typeIndex==TppGameObject.GAME_OBJECT_TYPE_COMMON_WALKERGEAR2 then rotY=foxmath.NormalizeRadian(foxmath.DegreeToRadian(rotY)) GameObject.SendCommand(gameId,{id="SetPosition",pos=pos,rotY=rotY}) elseif TppDefine.HOSTAGE_GM_TYPE[typeIndex] then pos=Vector3(pos[1],pos[2],pos[3]) GameObject.SendCommand(gameId,{id="Warp",degRotationY=rotY,position=pos}) end
